title: Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center (ATDC) in Suriname
description: In June 2017, a Chinese team of agricultural experts visited Suriname to survey the area of Wanica for the building of an Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center (ATDC). Chinese financing has been pledged with agency participation from the Suriname Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, and Fisheries; Deputy Directorate for Agricultural Research, Marketing and Processing (ODLOAV); and the Deputy Directorate Livestock (ODVEE). Although the Suriname Ministry of Agriculture lists China as the funder, the specifics of the financial body or terms are unclear.  With the initial investment of $350,000 USD (although the Share4Dev source states only $350) and total budget of $10.4 million USD, field visits and stakeholder meetings took place, which concluded that there was potential for a demonstration center to accommodate new technology, experiments, and training. In the project proposal, the center will include a greenhouses, packing house, aquaculture hatchery/nursery and is projected to finish in 2022. In addition, 33 hectares have been identified for the demonstration center in Tawajari-polder in the Wanica District.  Page 81 of the Suriname 2018 Annual Plan (Jaarplan) indicates there is still continued cooperation on this project. A feasibility study is also to be conducted in 2018.  An article published by GFC Nieuws in September 2019 provides one of the most recent updates to this project. In this article, it is noted that an agreement was signed by Chinese Ambassador to Suriname Liu Quan and Minister of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, and Fisheries Rabindre Parmessar earlier that month regarding the construction of the Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center. It is not known the exact date on which this agreement was signed or what precisely this agreement entailed.
combined_text:
# Sector
AGRICULTURE, FORESTRY, FISHING

# Title
Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center (ATDC) in Suriname

# Description
In June 2017, a Chinese team of agricultural experts visited Suriname to survey the area of Wanica for the building of an Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center (ATDC). Chinese financing has been pledged with agency participation from the Suriname Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, and Fisheries; Deputy Directorate for Agricultural Research, Marketing and Processing (ODLOAV); and the Deputy Directorate Livestock (ODVEE). Although the Suriname Ministry of Agriculture lists China as the funder, the specifics of the financial body or terms are unclear.  With the initial investment of $350,000 USD (although the Share4Dev source states only $350) and total budget of $10.4 million USD, field visits and stakeholder meetings took place, which concluded that there was potential for a demonstration center to accommodate new technology, experiments, and training. In the project proposal, the center will include a greenhouses, packing house, aquaculture hatchery/nursery and is projected to finish in 2022. In addition, 33 hectares have been identified for the demonstration center in Tawajari-polder in the Wanica District.  Page 81 of the Suriname 2018 Annual Plan (Jaarplan) indicates there is still continued cooperation on this project. A feasibility study is also to be conducted in 2018.  An article published by GFC Nieuws in September 2019 provides one of the most recent updates to this project. In this article, it is noted that an agreement was signed by Chinese Ambassador to Suriname Liu Quan and Minister of Agriculture, Animal Husbandry, and Fisheries Rabindre Parmessar earlier that month regarding the construction of the Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center. It is not known the exact date on which this agreement was signed or what precisely this agreement entailed.
justification: Project focuses on agricultural technology demonstration and training without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Agricultural Technology Demonstration Center, focus on technology transfer and training in agriculture, includes greenhouses and aquaculture facilities

title: China donates food and school supplies to Hope For Children
description: On July 19, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Suriname visited the Hope For Children center (HVK; Hoop voor Kinderen) to hand over food and school supplies to the children. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.  HVK was founded in May 2017 and takes care of more than 50 children.

title: China donates 8 bicycles for students
description: On May 10, 2017, the Chinese Embassy in Suriname handed over 8 bicycles to the office of the wife of the President of Suriname, Ingrid Bouterse. The bicycles will be sent to the homes of students to provide them with transportation for getting to and from school, in promotion of a green lifestyle. The monetary value of the donation is unknown.

title: Chinese Embassy donates schoolbags to 200 students
description: On August 11, 2017, a handover ceremony was held for the Chinese Embassy donation of school supplies, such as schoolbags and stationary, to more than 200 local elementary school students. Ambassador Zhang Jinxiong and Suriname First Lady Ingrid Bouterse were present at the ceremony.

title: Chinese Government provides $1 million grant to WHO for emergency assistance and al-Mouwasat Hospital Rehabilitation
description: In January 2017, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) provides $1 million grant to the World Health Organization (WHO) to improve food security and health conditions in Syria, and to provide special assistance to internally displaced people and returnees. This grant was part of a ‘South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund’ that the Chinese Government established with the WHO to support Syria.   $400,000 of the grant proceeds were allocated to the rehabilitation of the Emergency Department of Al Mouwasat Hospital (مستشفى المواساة الجامعي.) in the city of Damascus. The rehabilitation took six months to complete and it involved changing electrical connections and sanitation installations, the acquisition of medical equipment and necessary technical supplies, the installation of an elevator, the rehabilitation of operating rooms, and the provision of new furniture (including beds). . As of February 11, 2018, the project was completed.
staff_comments: The Chinese project title is 穆瓦萨特医院急诊中心改造项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government provides $1 million grant to WHO for emergency assistance and al-Mouwasat Hospital Rehabilitation

# Description
In January 2017, China’s Ministry of Commerce (MOFCOM) provides $1 million grant to the World Health Organization (WHO) to improve food security and health conditions in Syria, and to provide special assistance to internally displaced people and returnees. This grant was part of a ‘South-South Cooperation Assistance Fund’ that the Chinese Government established with the WHO to support Syria.   $400,000 of the grant proceeds were allocated to the rehabilitation of the Emergency Department of Al Mouwasat Hospital (مستشفى المواساة الجامعي.) in the city of Damascus. The rehabilitation took six months to complete and it involved changing electrical connections and sanitation installations, the acquisition of medical equipment and necessary technical supplies, the installation of an elevator, the rehabilitation of operating rooms, and the provision of new furniture (including beds). . As of February 11, 2018, the project was completed.
justification: Project focuses on humanitarian aid and hospital rehabilitation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Grant for emergency assistance, hospital rehabilitation, medical equipment, and social development in Syria

title: Chinese Government provides $1 million grant to ICRC for humanitarian relief activities in Manin
description: On May 15, 2017, according to the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and the Chinese Embassy in Syria, the Chinese Embassy to Syria agreed to provide a $1 million grant to the International Committee of the Red Cross for humanitarian aid for Syrian refugees. The project was completed and a handover certificate was issued on February 14, 2018.  The funds were earmarked for various projects in Manin (or Ain Manin or منين‎), which is is a small town in southern Syria about 18 kilometers north of Damascus. These projects included overhauling the water network, providing food and medical services, and the establishment of a bakery and a food kitchen. The ultimate goal of the grant was providing clean water, food, temporary shelter, and medical treatment for the internally displaced Syrians and refugees from neighboring countries.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government provides $1 million grant to ICRC for humanitarian relief activities in Manin

# Description
On May 15, 2017, according to the Chinese Ministry of Commerce and the Chinese Embassy in Syria, the Chinese Embassy to Syria agreed to provide a $1 million grant to the International Committee of the Red Cross for humanitarian aid for Syrian refugees. The project was completed and a handover certificate was issued on February 14, 2018.  The funds were earmarked for various projects in Manin (or Ain Manin or منين‎), which is is a small town in southern Syria about 18 kilometers north of Damascus. These projects included overhauling the water network, providing food and medical services, and the establishment of a bakery and a food kitchen. The ultimate goal of the grant was providing clean water, food, temporary shelter, and medical treatment for the internally displaced Syrians and refugees from neighboring countries.
justification: Project focuses on humanitarian aid and social development without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Humanitarian relief activities, water network overhaul, food and medical services, bakery and food kitchen establishment

title: Chinese Government provides $1 million grant — via WFP — to purchase and distribute 1,300 tons of green beans to over 1 million Syrians
description: On 23 August 2017, the Chinese government agreed to donate 1 million USD to the World Food Programme (WFP) for the provision of emergency food aid in Syria, according to the Chinese Embassy in Syria. The funds were used to purchase and distribute 1,300 tons of green beans to over 1 million people across Syria.   Distribution of the food occurred between December 2017 and February 2018. On April 4, 2018, a ceremony was held in Damascus, Syria marking the conclusion of China's aid delivery.
staff_comments: This CRS Sector was coded as 700 - Emergency Response as it purchased emergency food aid. This project was part of the UN Syria Humanitarian Response Plan 2017, and it corresponds to UNOCHA FTS Flow ID #163691.
combined_text:
# Sector
EMERGENCY RESPONSE

# Title
Chinese Government provides $1 million grant — via WFP — to purchase and distribute 1,300 tons of green beans to over 1 million Syrians

# Description
On 23 August 2017, the Chinese government agreed to donate 1 million USD to the World Food Programme (WFP) for the provision of emergency food aid in Syria, according to the Chinese Embassy in Syria. The funds were used to purchase and distribute 1,300 tons of green beans to over 1 million people across Syria.   Distribution of the food occurred between December 2017 and February 2018. On April 4, 2018, a ceremony was held in Damascus, Syria marking the conclusion of China's aid delivery.
justification: Project is focused on emergency food aid and humanitarian assistance, with no direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Emergency food aid distribution, humanitarian focus, no energy or infrastructure components
